title: Hardware Design Engineer Intern
duties: Designed, prototyped, and tested embedded hardware and software for low-cost water temperature and heading sensors
Took the initiative to learn and implement algorithms for tilt-compensated magnetometer-based heading sensors, ultimately resulted in the production of a higher-tier heading sensor alternative
Performed and documented primary investigation into new sonar transducer technologies
Took measures to seamlessly utilize the same design for multiple products to reduce hardware costs

title: Radar Simulation and Modeling Engineer Intern
duties: Designed and tested Matlab code for modeling foreign tracking radar systems​
Presented poster detailing work to company executives

title: Undergraduate Researcher
duties: Developed basic formation control and consensus algorithms for aerial swarm robotics under the supervision of Dr. Tansel Yucelen and a graduate mentor​
Installed and maintained large-area motion capture system

title: A LIDAR-based Navigation System for the Visually Impaired
duties: Developed code to extract and filter data from lidar system
Integrated lidar processing code and audio feedback code

title: Graduate Research Assistant
duties: ​Developed microfluidic devices for applications in cellular drug delivery and drug screening
Basic cellular procedures including cell culture, maintenance, treatment, tagging, & fluorescent microscopy
​CFD simulations of diluted species in laminar flow in COMSOL Multiphysics
Managed a 7-person senior design team of undergraduate engineering students

title: Graduate Research Assistant
duties: ​Senior member of team MARBLE in the DARPA Subterranean Challenge
Develop hardware for perception and mobility systems
​CFD simulations of diluted species in laminar flow in COMSOL Multiphysics

tasks: algorithmic- and machine learning-based robot motion planning techniques for highly cluttered environments

title: Electrical Hardware Architect
